JOUR458G - Special Topics in Journalism: How Sports Journalism Constructs Our World

Guide to selected resources for students preparing the annotated bibliography required in Prof. Kevin Blackistone's JOUR458G class (Fall 2015).
  • UM Libraries Overview
  • Primary, Secondary and Tertiary Sources

Maggie Saponaro

Subjects:Journalism

Contacting University Archives

For individual assistance with athletics materials in the University Archives, contact:

University Archivist Anne Turkos (aturkos@umd.edu or 301-405-9060)

or Assistant University Archivist Jason Speck (jgspeck@umd.edu or 301-405-9297)

or Athletics Archivist Amanda Hawk (ahawk@umd.edu or  301-314-3287)

Introduction

This is a guide to support students taking Journalism 458G.

Contact the subject specialist for more information on the resources suggested within this Guide, or for other sources to support research on Journalism topics.

Journalism History Materials in Special Collections

Hornbake Library houses a variety of archival materials on journalism and journalism history:

  • Selected List of Journalism Holdings in the Archives and Manuscripts Department, University of Maryland Libraries
  • Mass Media and Culture - UMD Special Collections

Additional Special Collections

In addition to the materials housed at Hornbake related to journalism and journalism history, the Libraries have many other Special Collections to support your research:

  • Digital Collections
  • State of Maryland Resources
  • Literature and Rare Books
  • U.S. Government Information, Maps, & GIS Services
  • University Archives

Library Website

For more information about the University Libraries, visit our website:
